required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Dose-Escalation Study of SPYK04 in Patients With Locally Advanced or Metastatic Solid Tumors (With Expansion).
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I, Open-Label, Multicenter, Dose Escalation and Cohort Expansion Study of SPYK04 as Monotherapy in Patients With Locally Advanced or Metastatic Solid Tumors

primary_outcome.measure: Safety and tolerability of SPYK04 (Dose limiting toxicities) [Dose escalation]
primary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose until the end of Cycle 1 (approximately 35 days)

primary_outcome.measure: Safety and tolerability of SPYK04 (Adverse Events) [Dose escalation]
primary_outcome.time_frame: From Cycle 0 Day 1 until 28 days after the last dose of study treatment, assessed up to 42 months (study completion)
primary_outcome.description: Incidence, nature, and severity of adverse events (AEs) as assessed by the NCI CTCAE v5.0

primary_outcome.measure: Safety and tolerability of SPYK04 (Electrocardiograms in triplicate) [Dose escalation]
primary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose until the end of Cycle 1 (approximately 35 days)
primary_outcome.description: Uncorrected QT interval, QTcF, PR duration, QRS interval and RR interval

primary_outcome.measure: Safety and tolerability of SPYK04 (Electrocardiograms in triplicate) [Dose escalation]
primary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose until the end of Cycle 1 (approximately 35 days)
From Cycle 0 Day 1 until 28 days after the last dose of study treatment, assessed up to 42 months (study completion)
From Cycle 0 Day 1 until 28 days after the last dose of study treatment, assessed up to 42 months (study completion)
From Cycle 0 Day 1 until 28 days after the last dose of study treatment, assessed up to 42 months (study completion)
primary_outcome.description: Time to reach maximum plasma drug concentration (Tmax) of SPYK04

primary_outcome.time_frame: From Cycle 0 Day 1 until 28 days after the last dose of study treatment, assessed up to 42 months (study completion)
primary_outcome.description: Area under the concentration versus time curve (AUC) of SPYK04

primary_outcome.measure: Preliminary anti-tumor activity of SPYK04 [Cohort expansion]
primary_outcome.time_frame: From screening until disease progression, study discontinuation, withdrawal or death, whichever occurs first, assessed up to 42 months (study completion)
primary_outcome.description: Objective Response Rate (ORR) is defined as proportion of patients who had a confirmed complete response (CR) or partial response (PR), as determined by the investigator with use of Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors version 1.1 (RECIST v1.1)

secondary_outcome.measure: Preliminary anti-tumor activity of SPYK04 [Dose escalation]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From screening until disease progression, study discontinuation, withdrawal or death, whichever occurs first, assessed up to 42 months (study completion)

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety and tolerability of SPYK04 (AEs) [Cohort expansion]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Cycle 1 Day 1 until 28 days after the last dose of study treatment, assessed up to 42 months (study completion)
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence, nature, and severity of AEs assessed by the NCI CTCAE v5.0

secondary_outcome.measure: Preliminary anti-tumor activity of SPYK04 [Cohort expansion]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From screening until disease progression, study discontinuation, withdrawal or death, whichever occurs first, assessed up to 42 months (study completion)
secondary_outcome.description: Disease control rate (DCR) is defined as proportion of patients who had an objective response or stable disease (SD), as determined by the investigator with use of RECIST v1.1

secondary_outcome.measure: Preliminary anti-tumor activity of SPYK04 [Cohort expansion]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From screening until disease progression, study discontinuation, withdrawal or death, whichever occurs first, assessed up to 42 months (study completion)
secondary_outcome.description: Progression-free survival (PFS) is defined as the time from the first study treatment to the first occurrence of progression as determined by the investigator using RECIST v1.1 or death from any cause, whichever occurs first

secondary_outcome.measure: Preliminary anti-tumor activity of SPYK04 [Cohort expansion]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From screening until disease progression, study discontinuation, withdrawal or death, whichever occurs first, assessed up to 42 months (study completion)
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of response (DoR) is defined for patients with a CR or PR at the time from the first documented CR or PR to documented disease progression as determined by the investigator with use of RECIST v1.1 or death from any cause, whichever occurs first

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Cycle 1 Day 1 until 28 days after the last dose of study treatment, assessed up to 42 months (study completion)
From Cycle 1 Day 1 until 28 days after the last dose of study treatment, assessed up to 42 months (study completion)
From Cycle 1 Day 1 until 28 days after the last dose of study treatment, assessed up to 42 months (study completion)
secondary_outcome.description: Time to reach maximum plasma drug concentration (Tmax) of SPYK04

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Cycle 1 Day 1 until 28 days after the last dose of study treatment, assessed up to 42 months (study completion)
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the concentration versus time curve (AUC) of SPYK04

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From screening until the time of partial response or stable disease lasting for more than 4 months, and the time of progressive disease, if possible, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: Expression level of pMEK and pERK in solid tumor tissues (e.g., baseline archival or biopsy, and on treatment biopsy)

clinical_study.condition: Locally Advanced or Metastatic Solid Tumors

arm_group.description: Patients will receive SPYK04 at escalated dose.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Expansion part in NSCLC, ovarian cancer and other solid tumors
arm_group.description: Patients will receive SPYK04 at the recommended dose.

intervention.arm_group_label: Expansion part in NSCLC, ovarian cancer and other solid tumors

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
(Both Part I and Part II)
- Age >= 18 years at time of signing informed consent form
- ECOG performance status of 0 or 1
- Patients with a locally advanced, recurrent, or metastatic solid tumor for which standard therapy either does not exist or has proven ineffective or intolerable
(Part I only)
- Patients with measurable and/or evaluable disease per RECIST v1.1
- Patients with MAPK pathway alterations positive solid tumor (i.e., BRAF, K/N/H-RAS mutations)
(Part II only)
- Patients with measurable disease per RECIST v1.1
- Patients with KRAS mutated NSCLC (NSCLC cohort)
- Patients with KRAS mutated Ovarian Cancer (Ovarian Cancer cohort)
- Patients with RAS mutated solid tumor (Biopsy cohort)
Exclusion Criteria:
(Both Part I and Part II)
- Significant cardiovascular disease, such as New York Heart Association (NYHA) cardiac disease (Class II or greater), unstable angina, or myocardial infarction within the previous 6 months or unstable arrhythmias within the previous 3 months
- Patients with primary central nervous system (CNS) malignancy, untreated CNS metastases requiring any anti-tumor treatment, or active CNS metastases
- Patients with current severe, uncontrolled systemic disease (including, but not limited to, clinically significant cardiovascular disease, pulmonary disease, or renal disease, ongoing or active infection)
- Patients with a history or complication of interstitial lung disease (ILD)

patient_data.ipd_description: Qualified researchers may request access to individual patient level data through the clinical study data request platform (www.clinicalstudydatarequest.com). For further details on Chugai's Data Sharing Policy and how to request access to related clinical study documents, see here (www.chugai-pharm.co.jp/english/profile/rd/ctds_request.html).
